CatDescriptText: Mrs. Celia Dixon, 2429 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" answer reads: "I really do. Perhaps in that way we might get better service, especially on the 85.  And too, we probably wouldn't have as many strikes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Celia Dixon, wearing oversized dark knit sweater, earrings, scarf, and light colored fuzzy gloves, holding dark handbag over left arm, standing in front of light colored marble pillar between storefront windows with display of lamps and jewelry
